definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to catch fire/to cook/to get angry

sentences.english: The breath of Jehovah, like a stream of brimstone , Sets it on fire.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華的氣如一股硫磺火，使它着起來。

sentences.english: In the middle of the bridge,his old car spluttered out.
sentences.chinese: 在過橋走到橋中間時，他的那輛破車劈啪響着熄了火。

sentences.english: Good,you know a lot about fire-safety.
sentences.chinese: 好，你關於火安全知道許多。

sentences.english: People stampeded from the burning cinema.
sentences.chinese: 人們從着了火的電影院裏紛紛逃出。

sentences.english: When in doubt, set something on fire.
sentences.chinese: 猶疑不決的時候，就便放把火吧。

sentences.english: Bending the ear of the hedgerow with stories of fire and sword.
sentences.chinese: 吹壓着籬木的耳朵，講述劍與火的故事。

sentences.english: Lunar olivine was created by great volcanoes called fire fountains, which sprayed superheated lava into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 月之橄欖石產生於名爲“火噴泉”的巨型火山。

sentences.english: The flames appear to have spread from the direction of a neighbouring cow farm.
sentences.chinese: 火似乎是從鄰近的一個養牛的牧場方向蔓延過來的。

sentences.english: That fire destroyed 38,000 acres and 21 homes.
sentences.chinese: 火火災造成了3萬8千英畝土地和21戶住宅的損失。

sentences.english: Needless to say, he had a stomach fire in Fu Youli.
sentences.chinese: 不用說，他這一肚子的火又發在了傅由理身上。

sentences.english: His symbol was fire and a blacksmith's hammer.
sentences.chinese: 他的象徵是火和鐵匠的錘子。

sentences.english: His finger was jammed in a train door.
sentences.chinese: 他的手指被火車門軋傷了。

sentences.english: I could not hold my calmness any more and shouted at him irritatingly.
sentences.chinese: 我再也無法平靜，眼睛噴了火，逼視着他。

sentences.english: The building which stands near the train station is a supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 位於火趁魅站四周的那座年夜樓是一家超市。

sentences.english: Turn the heat down and stir briefly and let cook for about 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 轉小火，稍微翻炒，大約5分鐘。

sentences.english: He comes to school to talk about fire-safety.

definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to set fire to/to burn down/burning hot/baked cake
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
to make a fire/to light a fire
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
